scrolls.title: Home Row Oath
scrolls.summary: A short pledge for steady wrists before lessons begin.
scrolls.body: Float your wrists and breathe. Let fingers rest on A S D F and J K L ; like lanterns along the wall. Soft taps beat heavy strikes; the castle hears your rhythm first.

scrolls.title: Courier Notes
scrolls.summary: Messages dashed between lanes during early drills.
scrolls.body: Couriers sprint between towers with parchment tucked in their belts. They pass tips like relay batons: eyes forward, shoulder loose, reset grip every few waves. When hands relax, the words run faster.

scrolls.title: Signal Flares
scrolls.summary: How defenders mark a clean streak across lessons.
scrolls.body: Signal lamps flash over the battlements whenever a lesson ends without a stumble. Three quick blinks mean steady pace; a long glow means perfect form. The garrison reads those lights like quiet applause.

scrolls.title: Archivist Margins
scrolls.summary: Lyra's margin notes on why drills stay short and calm.
scrolls.body: Lyra scribbles in the margins: short passages keep readers relaxed, and light stories are a rest between waves. If tension creeps in, slow to walking speed and rebuild. Letters stay loyal when treated kindly.

scrolls.title: Watch Captain's Journal
scrolls.summary: An encouraging entry for late night study sessions.
scrolls.body: The watch captain writes by lantern: "We hold the gate by habits, not haste." He circles the mantra twice—breathe, align, glance ahead—and leaves a note for the next reader: take pride in unrolling every scroll.
